tiled.core

Class TileLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tiled.core.MapLayer
      • tiled.core.TileLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class TileLayer
extends MapLayer
    A TileLayer is a specialized MapLayer, used for tracking two dimensional tile data.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class tiled.core.MapLayer

        MIRROR_HORIZONTAL, MIRROR_VERTICAL, ROTATE_180, ROTATE_270, ROTATE_90

      • mirror

        public void mirror(int dir)
        Performs a mirroring function on the layer data. Two orientations are allowed: vertical and horizontal. Example: layer.mirror(MapLayer.MIRROR_VERTICAL); will mirror the layer data around a horizontal axis.
        Specified by:
        mirror in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        dir - the axial orientation to mirror around

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed(Tile t)
        Checks to see if the given Tile is used anywhere in the layer.
        Parameters:
        t - a Tile object to check for
        Returns:
        true if the Tile is used at least once, false otherwise.

      • createDiff

        public MapLayer createDiff(MapLayer ml)
        Creates a diff of the two layers, ml is considered the significant difference.
        Specified by:
        createDiff in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        ml -
        Returns:
        A new MapLayer that represents the difference between this layer, and the argument, or null if no difference exists.

      • removeTile

        public void removeTile(Tile tile)
        Removes any occurences of the given tile from this map layer. If layer is locked, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        tile - the Tile to be removed

      • setTileAt

        public void setTileAt(int tx,
             int ty,
             Tile ti)
        Sets the tile at the specified position. Does nothing if (tx, ty) falls outside of this layer.
        Parameters:
        tx - x position of tile
        ty - y position of tile
        ti - the tile object to place

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int tx,
             int ty)
        Returns the tile at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        tx - Tile-space x coordinate
        ty - Tile-space y coordinate
        Returns:
        tile at position (tx, ty) or null when (tx, ty) is outside this layer

      • locationOf

        public java.awt.Point locationOf(Tile t)
        Returns the first occurrence (using top down, left to right search) of the given tile.
        Parameters:
        t - the Tile to look for
        Returns:
        A java.awt.Point instance of the first instance of t, or null if it is not found

      • replaceTile

        public void replaceTile(Tile find,
               Tile replace)
        Replaces all occurrences of the Tile find with the Tile replace in the entire layer
        Parameters:
        find - the tile to replace
        replace - the replacement tile

      • mergeOnto

        public void mergeOnto(MapLayer other)
        Description copied from class: MapLayer
        Merges the tile data of this layer with the specified layer. The calling layer is considered the significant layer, and will overwrite the data of the argument layer. At cells where the calling layer has no data, the argument layer data is preserved.
        Specified by:
        mergeOnto in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        other - the insignificant layer to merge with

      • maskedMergeOnto

        public void maskedMergeOnto(MapLayer other,
                   java.awt.geom.Area mask)
        Like mergeOnto, but will only copy the area specified.
        Specified by:
        maskedMergeOnto in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        other -
        mask -
        See Also:
        mergeOnto(MapLayer)

      • copyFrom

        public void copyFrom(MapLayer other)
        Copy data from another layer onto this layer. Unlike mergeOnto, copyFrom() copies the empty cells as well.
        Specified by:
        copyFrom in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        other -
        See Also:
        MapLayer.mergeOnto(tiled.core.MapLayer)

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(MapLayer other)
        Unlike mergeOnto, copyTo includes the null tile when merging.
        Specified by:
        copyTo in class MapLayer
        Parameters:
        other - the layer to copy this layer to
        See Also:
